programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from York, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing questions from the audience

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actress Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud, and Bluey

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: A campaign to warn of birth defects in babies whose mothers take the epilepsy drug sodium valproate while pregnant. Plus, fake medicines being touted as 'cures' for autism

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, crew members Kevin and Martyn treat a man suffering from blinding headaches, and in Dunfermline Jason and Billy attend a 94-year-old who has fallen at home and cannot get back up. In Paisley, Peter and Kirsty attend a minor road traffic collision. Although the driver seems fine, the crew explain why they like to keep patients like this in the ambulance for 20 minutes or so, just in case there is a delayed reaction to the accident. In Ayr, a man has walked into a plate glass window, and although he seems fine, Elaine and Arin are concerned about the bump to his head

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned online in Stoke-on-Trent, Chestfield in Kent and west London. They are later bought by developers who hope to make money on their investments - two projects are destined for the rental market, while the third is about building new houses and selling them on

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp is in her home city of Glasgow, where she visits the world-famous Burrell Collection - 9,000 rare antiques and artworks that were donated to the city in 1944. Meanwhile, Danny Sebastian and Roo Irvine help the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Sparks fly when Marlene meets an outspoken farmer who hates the police, who has accused a rival of sabotaging her milking equipment. Not only does he have an alibi, but he responds with a counter accusation of dumping toxic waste. Meanwhile, a stressed-out Finn is pushed to breaking point

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: A team of cleaners and DIY experts has just one day to help a household reclaim their space and fall back in love with their home. Here, the squad visits south Wales, coming to the rescue of a busy entrepreneur who has no time to 'fix! her house. They must organise her messy living room into a space that the whole family can use and where she can run her business effectively, while also cleaning and organising months of clutter and grime. Presented by Asher Edwards, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is in Norfolk to help a couple with an £800,000 budget buy their first property together, and rides on a narrow gauge steam train when he meets the enthusiasts keeping the Bure Valley Railway running

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid on a wooden toy bus, a unicycle, a hand-made model of a mill, a Norwegian pan from the 1970s and a ladder believed to have been used in a French library in the early 20th century. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Rose Matafeo joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic medal-winning gymnast Nile Wilson, England rugby star Shaunagh Brown, Great Britain sprinter Adam Gemili and rugby league legend Paul Sculthorpe join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: A compilation of the best bits from series 15, hosted by Rob Brydon. David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Bob Mortimer, Alan Titchmarsh, Sarah Millican, Holly Willoughby, Jim Broadbent and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining hopefuls serve up the two courses they hope will see them through to knockout week. John Torode and Gregg Wallace taste their efforts, as well as three previous champions - -Thomasina Miers (2005), Kenny Tutt (2018) and Saliha Mahmood-Ahmed (2017). With just two places up for grabs, the amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to this year's trophy

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: David Tennant hosts the current affairs quiz, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Lucy Beaumont joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a quiet town where someone has thrown a bucket of blood over a statue at the middle of a protest. Unfortunately, as he sets about cleaning it up, it becomes clear that the row is far from over and he finds himself embroiled in a debate that looks like it might turn nasty. Zoe Wanamaker, Susannah Fielding and Louis Emerick guest star

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Blinded by the Light (2019)
programme.desc: Javed Khan is a British-Pakistani college student living in 1980s Bedfordshire under a domineering father. Facing parental pressure and everyday racism, he unexpectedly finds his frustrations and ambitions expressed in Bruce Springsteen songs. Inspired by the rock star and a teacher who encourages his own writing, he sets out to fulfill his dreams. Coming-of-age drama, starring Viveik Kalra, Kulvinder Ghir and Meera Ganatra

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Andi Oliver and Chet Sharma, with guest Adam Kay. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc: The culinary expert offers tips for cooking delicious meals, including aubergine caponata, a warming vegetable noodle soup, and her chicken and herb casserole. Mary Berry also meets fellow foodies who love growing their own ingredients

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Manchester City v Sheffield United and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United in the FA Cup semi-finals

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Profiling contenders for the men's, women's and wheelchair races, and telling the stories of inspirational amateur runners

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round matches - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Ronnie O'Sullivan v Hossein Vafaei. Robertson will be looking to wrap up his match today, but he was eliminated at this stage of last year's tournament by Jack Lisowski, despite a maximum 147 break

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Impressionist Alistair McGowan, football influencer Chris Dixon, comedian Laura Lexx and BBC Sport journalist Holly Hamilton are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Claude Debussy, British birds of prey, the history of alternative comedy, and Roald Dahl's Matilda

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan invites celebrity athletes Aimee Fuller, Iwan Thomas, Carlton Cole, Ryan Sidebottom, Kadeena Cox, Perri Shakes-Drayton, Pamela Cookey and Phil Vickery to bank money for chosen charities as they answer questions against the clock, blocking out rivals at the end of each round

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Rachel Riley, Baga Chipz, Liza Tarbuck, Rhod Gilbert, Ore Oduba and Scarlett Moffatt

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Chelsee Healey, Anthony Quinlan, Sophie Duker, Jenny Bede, Ugo Monye, Danny Care, Beverley Craven and Patti Boulaye try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain tries to show a reckless student paramedic how the job is done, only for the new recruit to abandon a patient suffering from chest pains to come to the aid of a shopkeeper who has taken desperate measures to defend himself. Gethin pushes Jan's patience to the limit, Faith learns to trust her children, and Dylan and Donna come to an arrangement

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: As Susan and Charles attend the funeral of Alan Conway, his creation Atticus Pünd and his faithful secretary Fraser are also attending the funeral of Sir Magnus Pye. Much to Susan's horror, she realises that her world and Conway's fiction have more in common than mere coincidence

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leicester City v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Liverpool v Nottingham Forest. Leicester and Wolves are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Forest are also in danger, but did prevail 1-0 when they met Liverpool at the City Ground in October. Plus, Fulham v Leeds United, Brentford v Aston Villa and Crystal Palace v Everton

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Micah Richards and Alan Shearer to count down memorable races for the Premier League title

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarah's spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a home by the sea in Devon or Dorset, and rides a three-wheeled bicycle with a scheme which helps people to explore the area's coastline

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more people bring their items to the dealers to sell. First in is Billy with a large two-seater spaceship from the funfair, followed by Nyree with a French decanter she found in a charity shop. Next in is Lee with a 1970s pay phone in original and working condition and Kevin with a Hornby train set he has owned for 60 years. Finally, Carole enters hoping luck is on her side as she tries to sell her tombola machine

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedians Alan Davies and Ivo Graham and actresses Samantha Bond and Sunetra Sarker, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are The Space Between Us by Doug Johnstone and Lullaby by Leila Slimani

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A woman suspects a workman in her garden is guilty of a crime and a council witness the worst fly-tipper they've ever seen. Plus a burglar has a painful encounter with a tree

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls, the day's talking points and interviews on today's news

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Robert Milkins v Joe Perry. Coverage of the second and concluding session of the first-round match at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, with Perry holding a 7-2 lead

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Mark Selby v Matthew Selt in the first round, and the start of the second-round contest between Luca Brecel and Mark Williams. Selby has won the title on four occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming two years ago, when he overcame Shaun Murphy in the final

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: The latest guest at the B&B is actor Larry Lamb, who is no stranger to Northern Ireland. During Larry's stay he meets a special Japanese herd who help provide the star ingredient for the evening meal, a twist on the classic beef wellington with a Northern Irish wagyu steak, served with smoked mash and red cabbage. Sharon and driver Rory take Larry to a local spot he's never visited before - the picturesque seaside town of Ballycastle. Before checking out, chef Alex takes Larry under his wing baking a unique take on a Northern Irish soda bread, with bacon and eggs

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simon's journey begins at the Giant's Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwell's influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Kwesi, 70, checks in to the hotel in north Wales in the hope of meeting his daughter Ruth, who was adopted at birth. Childhood friends Noah and Matt haven't seen each other for more than 12 years, but want to reconnect after an often-difficult teenage relationship. And a group of women who became the first all-female relay expedition to the North Pole hope to have a long-awaited reunion. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Why Buildings Collapse
programme.desc: Documentary examining the collapse of the Champlain Towers South apartment building in Miami in 2021, and looking at the implications for other buildings around the world. The programme explores the factors that might have led to the collapse, and also looks to the future to ask what lessons can be learnt from this disaster

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola introduces fellow comedians Scott Bennett and Helen Bauer to the stage of the legendary Hammersmith venue

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring first and second-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights from a match on day six of the tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary reveals how after Bill Cosby struck gold with The Cosby Show, a genre-defining family sitcom and monument to black excellence, he began leveraging his growing power inside the entertainment industry

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A vintage car - once a father-and-son project but now rusting away - and a cake stand with huge sentimental value are among the objects transformed

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a woman and her dog find a home in Surrey on a budget of £500,000. They also visit a Grade one listed cemetery where they meet volunteers who maintain grounds

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as members of the public invite the dealers to bid on their items - a model plane, a ride-on funfair whale, a draughtsman's kit, a set of stilts and a transforming table ideal for picnics

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of four compilation programmes, Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Plus, Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge

programme.desc: Calls, the day's talking points and interviews on today's news

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day seven at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the opening frames of two second-round contests - Ronnie O'Sullivan v Hossein Vafaei, and Mark Allen v Stuart Bingham

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent keep their eyes on the prize before Richard Osman announces this week's winner

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Television, stage and radio star Debbie McGee adds some magic to the B&B. Her first stop on her Northern Irish adventure is the local smokehouse whose owner Ruairidh Morrison has mastered the art of hot and cold smoking local salmon to perfection. Debbie found a love of the kitchen cooking for her late husband Paul Daniels, so fits right at home with chef Alex in the B&B kitchen. Together they whip up a seafood feast and a sweet treat incorporating the locally smoked black pepper. Before Debbie checks out she visits a glassblower, where she discovers the art of glassblowing with an unusual ingredient

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores North Radnorshire and Montgomeryshire. He begins his journey on a beautiful pasture at Tylcau Hill near Llanbister bursting with colour from wildflowers and rare butterflies. Next stop is Dolfor near Newtown, one of the last remaining strongholds for the curlew in Wales

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Lizzie Schofield and Calum Clunie have tips for making gardens as productive as possible, while the team clears up winter storm damage - taking down a fence damaged in the high winds of January and coming up with a creative alternative

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill finally has her own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life. Toby Buckland meets a man who's planted his plot with a wonderful array of fruit and nut trees. And cameras focus on a gardener in Gloucestershire who discusses the 500 pot plants she's designed especially to produce a floral firework display

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: In the medieval city of Coimbra, Millie, Su, Vickie, Shane and Bobby visit the St Theresa convent, Nabil finds a mosque for Friday prayers and invites Rita to join him. Keen to connect with her own Jewish culture, Rita seeks out an old synagogue in Tamar and asks Millie to accompany her. Then after 14 days and 364 kilometres, the group finally reaches the Sanctuary of Fatima

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Mark Lawson joins Philomena Cunk to discuss the first half of the 20th century, an era of two world wars but no world cup. Comedy documentary, starring Diane Morgan

programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha conclude their investigation into how their own and other families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They are joined by a woman who wants to find out why, when she was a child, her aunts left Egypt for the new state of Israel, and a woman who wants to know what happened to her family as her grandfather struggled to hold on to his land and orange groves in Jaffa

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers head to Scotland for their next challenge, making-over a hotel room at a five-star golf and spa resort with just two days and a budget of £2,000. Half of the competitors are given a brief for a maximalist design for the hotel's more outdoorsy guests, while the others must create a tranquil space for those looking for a relaxing spa visit. With a double elimination looming, the designers pull out all the tricks they have up their sleeves to impress Alan, Michelle and guest judge Matthew Williamson

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver helps plant the Blue Peter vegetable patch, and the Awesome Orbit competition winner goes behind the scenes at a UK rocket launch

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall goes in search of the fastest predators on earth, testing the speed and accuracy of a gannet dive in an experiment in his junkyard using a crane and an old caravan

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the morning session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre, featuring the conclusion of Mark Allen v Stuart Bingham in round two, along with the start of another match

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts the semi-final of the cooking challenge. Mary Berry challenges the remaining contestants to prepare a fish supper, Chris Bavin asks them to come up with a meal that puts mushrooms front and centre, and Angela Hartnett sets them the task of making crab ravioli with homemade pasta dough. After a dramatic end to the final challenge, one more celebrity leaves the kitchen

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the match in the fourth round of fixtures, held at Musgrave Park. England will go into this match as strong favourites given their superior form so far this year and their emphatic 69-0 victory when the sides met in Leicester last year

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the afternoon session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round matches - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Ronnie O'Sullivan v Hossein Vafaei

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Adam Partridge and Christina Trevanion value objects at Hereford Cathedral, while presenter Paul Martin attempts to make a traditional wooden stool

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of two second-round matches. Mark Selby will be involved in one of these contests should he have come through his first-round encounter and will be looking to avoid his fate at this stage last year, when the 2021 champion relinquished his crown following a 13-10 defeat at the hands of Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Piano Greats at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of songs from the kings and queens of the keyboards, whose performances have captivated audiences over the decades across a selection of the BBC's best-loved music programmes. From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland

programme.title: Little Richard: King and Queen of Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: The life and career of the pioneering musician, a black artist who grew up in the segregated American South and broke down barriers and took 1950s America by storm. The Beatles and the Rolling Stones supported him and took inspiration from his musicianship and stagecraft, and he went on to influence artists as diverse as David Bowie, Elton John, Michael Jackson and Prince. Featuring interviews with Ringo Starr, Keith Richards, Nile Rodgers and Big Freedia, alongside intimate contributions from friends, bandmates and Little Richard himself, this feature-length documentary tells the story of a rollercoaster life

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from second-round matches on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a second-round match from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.desc: In the medieval city of Coimbra, Millie, Su, Vickie, Shane and Bobby visit the St Theresa convent, Nabil finds a mosque for Friday prayers and invites Rita to join him. Keen to connect with her own Jewish culture, Rita seeks out an old synagogue in Tamar and asks Millie to accompany her. Then after 14 days and 364 kilometres, the group finally reaches the Sanctuary of Fatima

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui in round one, and the start of the second-round contest between Mark Allen and Stuart Bingham. Murphy was a champion in 2005 and has been a runner-up on three occasions since, most recently when he was defeated by Mark Selby two years ago, but he lost to Stephen Maguire in the first round in 2022

programme.title: School for Scoundrels (1960)
programme.desc: A timid company owner is pushed around by his employees, deceived by a car salesman, humiliated by a waiter and finally loses his girlfriend to a dastardly rival. Salvation comes in the form of an unusual college dedicated to teaching students how to succeed through being manipulative and devious, and he sets about getting even with his enemies. Comedy, starring Ian Carmichael, Terry-Thomas, Alastair Sim and Janette Scott

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt (1953)
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day seven at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round contests - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Luca Brecel v Mark Williams. Robertson made a maximum 147 break in round two last year, the fifth of his career and the 12th time a 147 had been achieved at the Crucible, but would still go on to lose the match 13-11 to Jack Lisowski

programme.title: When Albums Ruled the World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the heyday of LPs from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s, as bands and singers embraced the creative opportunities they offered for music and artwork. The programme also examines how the arrival of new formats heralded the end of the album's golden era. programme.title: British Sitcom: 60 Years of Laughing at Ourselves

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The oil palm is a remarkable tree, with an incredibly diverse fruit that can be used for many different things - from shampoo and soap to toothpaste, crisps and chocolate. Unfortunately, the spread of this remarkable plant is leading to the destruction of the rainforests, particularly in Borneo and Sumatra. So what can we do? Firstly, learn where your food is coming from. Pay attention to the labels and look out for sustainable palm oil. We can’t get rid of palm oil altogether as it is in countless products, and many of the alternatives would be worse. But there are different ways of making palm oil, some of which will not completely destroy the forests. The next thing you could do is buy some forest for yourself. It is possible to fundraise, to get money to purchase a piece of perfect rainforest and protect it. So why not see if you can wash cars, and buy a piece of forest the size of your classroom, the size of your assembly hall, possibly even the size of your school. Finally, think

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Love Monster has been chosen as the prize-picker at the Harvest Day contest, but when he gets there it turns out there is only one prize and three teams. This means he has to choose a winner between his friends - Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, Bad Idea Puppy and the In-Chicks. Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Alistair wants to find out about red squirrels in today’s episode. Rory and Sandy head deep into the forest to try and find some red squirrels, whilst Chantelle heads offshore to an island to meet a local expert who has been studying them in the wild. Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Alistair’s questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem, we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, red squirrels are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Rory shows Sandy what it might feel like to be a red squirrel as he jumps around in the treetops.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Meagaidh the Border Collie is a search and rescue dog who works with her owner Tom. Her supernose follows scents and smells like clues, so they can rescue people who need their help. Meagaidh and Tom are visiting a school to show the children how a search and rescue dog works. They demonstrate some of their equipment, including Meagaidh’s special doggy goggles, which she wears to keep the wind and dust out of her eyes when she’s in the helicopter. Tom demonstrates how Meagaidh is lowered from the helicopter all the way down to the ground using a special harness. They also demonstrate a practice rescue mission, playing hide-and-seek with the children to show them how Meagaidh’s supernose can follows scents and smells like clues. But when the school cook goes missing with the children’s cheese sandwiches, Meagaidh has to use her supernose for real. Can she help Tom track down the cook and rescue the children's lunches?

programme.desc: In Edinburgh, crew members Kevin and Martyn treat a man suffering from blinding headaches, and in Dunfermline Jason and Billy attend a 94-year-old who has fallen at home and cannot get back up. In Paisley, Peter and Kirsty attend a minor road traffic collision. Although the driver seems fine, the crew explain why they like to keep patients like this in the ambulance for 20 minutes or so, just in case there is a delayed reaction to the accident. In Ayr, a man has walked into a plate glass window, and although he seems fine, Elaine and Arin are concerned about the bump to his head

programme.desc: A team of cleaners and DIY experts has just one day to help a household reclaim their space and fall back in love with their home. Here, the squad visits south Wales, coming to the rescue of a busy entrepreneur who has no time to 'fix! her house. They must organise her messy living room into a space that the whole family can use and where she can run her business effectively, while also cleaning and organising months of clutter and grime. Presented by Asher Edwards, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans explores the BBC Wales archive of the 1970s to share some nostalgia and a few memories of his own. He begins in the year 1970, including Mary Hopkin at the Eurovision Song Contest, a novelist who shares her home with farm animals and some surprisingly familiar tales of strikes, petrol price rises and power cuts. The sports world saw Tony Cordle hit winning runs for Glamorgan at St Helens in Swansea, and there's also footage of the fire on the historic Britannia Bridge over the Menai Strait

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining hopefuls serve up the two courses they hope will see them through to knockout week. John Torode and Gregg Wallace taste their efforts, as well as three previous champions - -Thomasina Miers (2005), Kenny Tutt (2018) and Saliha Mahmood-Ahmed (2017). With just two places up for grabs, the amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to this year's trophy

Zoe Wanamaker, Susannah Fielding and Louis Emerick guest star

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, crew members Kevin and Martyn treat a man suffering from blinding headaches, and in Dunfermline Jason and Billy attend a 94-year-old who has fallen at home and cannot get back up. programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Sparks fly when Marlene meets an outspoken farmer who hates the police, who has accused a rival of sabotaging her milking equipment. programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: A team of cleaners and DIY experts has just one day to help a household reclaim their space and fall back in love with their home. Here, the squad visits south Wales, coming to the rescue of a busy entrepreneur who has no time to 'fix! her house. They must organise her messy living room into a space that the whole family can use and where she can run her business effectively, while also cleaning and organising months of clutter and grime. Presented by Asher Edwards, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: A special marine edition of the programme, with Dougie Vipond in Arran to find out how 15 years of a fishing ban has transformed a No Take Zone in Lamlash Bay. Arlene Stuart gets an insight into trout breeding she'll never forget. The town of Cromarty has a population of just 700, but 100 of them are coastal rowers, so Anne Lundon takes to the sea to investigate why it is such a fast growing pastime

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic medal-winning gymnast Nile Wilson, England rugby star Shaunagh Brown, Great Britain sprinter Adam Gemili and rugby league legend Paul Sculthorpe join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining hopefuls serve up the two courses they hope will see them through to knockout week. John Torode and Gregg Wallace taste their efforts, as well as three previous champions - -Thomasina Miers (2005), Kenny Tutt (2018) and Saliha Mahmood-Ahmed (2017). With just two places up for grabs, the amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to this year's trophy

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: David Tennant hosts the current affairs quiz, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Lucy Beaumont joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Wicky is called to a quiet town where someone has thrown a bucket of blood over a statue at the middle of a protest. Unfortunately, as he sets about cleaning it up, it becomes clear that the row is far from over and he finds himself embroiled in a debate that looks like it might turn nasty. Zoe Wanamaker, Susannah Fielding and Louis Emerick guest star

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Blinded by the Light (2019)
programme.desc: Javed Khan is a British-Pakistani college student living in 1980s Bedfordshire under a domineering father. Facing parental pressure and everyday racism, he unexpectedly finds his frustrations and ambitions expressed in Bruce Springsteen songs. Inspired by the rock star and a teacher who encourages his own writing, he sets out to fulfill his dreams. Coming-of-age drama, starring Viveik Kalra, Kulvinder Ghir and Meera Ganatra

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting the ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round matches - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Ronnie O'Sullivan v Hossein Vafaei. programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Rachel Riley, Baga Chipz, Liza Tarbuck, Rhod Gilbert, Ore Oduba and Scarlett Moffatt

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain tries to show a reckless student paramedic how the job is done, only for the new recruit to abandon a patient suffering from chest pains to come to the aid of a shopkeeper who has taken desperate measures to defend himself. Gethin pushes Jan's patience to the limit, Faith learns to trust her children, and Dylan and Donna come to an arrangement

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: As Susan and Charles attend the funeral of Alan Conway, his creation Atticus Pünd and his faithful secretary Fraser are also attending the funeral of Sir Magnus Pye. Much to Susan's horror, she realises that her world and Conway's fiction have more in common than mere coincidence

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarah's spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: In Paisley, crew members Gary and Peter rush to treat a patient whose heart rate is dangerously fast. They are able to stabilise him by using an old trick - bumping him down the stairs in a wheelchair, which stimulates his vagus nerve and slows his heart rate - before transporting him to hospital. In Melrose, Lee and Nadine attend a 40-year-old woman with severe Covid symptoms. She is struggling to walk, and the crew gives her oxygen in the ambulance on the way to hospital.

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Lucas' dad is so cool - that must be why Lucas is cool! programme.desc: Tommy Hicks of the Midsomer Yeomanry finally has his name added to the Midsomer Parva war memorial, though he was shot for cowardice at the Somme in the First World War. It becomes apparent that time has not healed the rift between his descendants and the residents of Hammond Hall, whose patriarch Duggie Hammond pulled the trigger on his comrade all those years ago. A drink-fuelled mock trial of retired colonel Henry Hammond leads to a killing, and Tom Barnaby has to unravel the tangle of bitterness linking property developer Dave Hicks's brood with their neighbours. programme.desc: An anonymous enemy goes all out to ruin Wycliffe by sending the police a batch of photos apparently showing him taking bribes. programme.desc: The actor learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. In Sri Lanka, fishing manta rays is legal but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: A look back at Martin's time in Africa, which left an indelible mark on him. In 2012, he was involved in an extraordinary mission to return lions to the wild in Kenya, and it started with a lion cub called Mugi. This mission had all the makings of a big adventure, both for Mugi and Tony Fitzjohn, the man who was having his dream realised

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When director Nick Cheyney is found beheaded by a guillotine on the set of his latest film, Barnaby and Jones are left with no shortage of suspects. The victim, it transpires, was on poor terms with several people in some way connected to the project, including the mother of his child, and an actor who blamed him for ruining his career. Guest starring Nicky Henson

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A photographer is murdered shortly after exhibiting a compromising picture of Barnaby - who becomes a suspect in the ensuing investigation. Joyce concludes that someone is trying to frame him, and is stunned when he admits to a previous relationship with the murdered man's wife. Jones is forced to work with the irritating Martin Spellman to solve the case. Guest starring Liza Goddard, Adrian Scarborough and Richard Lintern

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer Parva hosts the revival of a traditional pagan festival, but tragedy strikes when curate Alex Dakin is burned alive inside a straw effigy of a woman. The body count rises as an apparent victim of spontaneous combustion, a budding photographer and a newly arrived schoolteacher are the next to be roasted alive. Keith Barron guest stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie's girlfriend is critically injured in a restaurant bomb blast, prompting him to seek revenge. When it transpires the intended target was an apparently unimportant accountant, Bodie ignores Cowley's orders and begins probing the man's past. Lewis Collins stars

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry acts as the bodyguard for a Lebanese businessman and diplomat. However, relationships between the two are strained and when their safe house is raided by gunmen, Terry's opinion of his charge reaches a new depth. Dennis Waterman and Kenneth Griffith star

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: First episode of the fantasy drama, starring William Gaunt, Alexandra Bastedo and Stuart Damon. Felix Aylmer and Burt Kwouk guest

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.desc: James Bond investigates the mysterious death of a British agent in East Berlin, a mission that leads him to a glamorous, international jewel thief. Spy adventure, with Roger Moore, Maud Adams, Steven Berkoff and Louis Jourdan

programme.desc: A huge scandal threatens Bohemia, as Holmes is outwitted by a bewitching woman's blackmail who owns a compromising photograph of a European royal. programme.title: Hornblower
programme.desc: Conclusion. Despite his reservations, Hornblower is reluctant to dishonour his bride-to-be by leaving her standing at the altar. However, with the ink barely dry on the marriage certificate, a surprise guest at the wedding breakfast despatches the groom to France on a mission to uncover the whereabouts of a missing sloop and its captain, Bracegirdle. En route, Hornblower rescues two strangers caught in a storm. Historical Navy drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Robert Lindsay, Paul McGann and Lorcan Cranitch

programme.title: ITV Racing: The Opening Show
programme.desc: Oli Bell and the team are joined by former Scottish National-winning jockey Tom Scudamore at Ayr ahead of the 2023 race, plus all the fallout from last weekend's Grand National

programme.title: The Big Match Revisited
programme.desc: Action from September 1977, featuring Fulham v Tottenham Hotspur, Manchester City v Manchester United and Leicester City v Everton

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How traditional seaside rock is made, a process that has not changed since Victorian times. Plus, how a new fire extinguisher is saving lives around the world. Jimmy Nail narrates

programme.title: Shalako (1968)
programme.desc: A party of European aristocrats on a hunting trip in New Mexico falls foul of marauding Apaches and the treachery of a guide, who abandons the group and makes off with their possessions. However, a US army scout knows of their presence in the territory and sets out to the rescue. Western, with Sean Connery, Brigitte Bardot, Jack Hawkins, Honor Blackman, Woody Strode, Peter Van Eyck and Eric Sykes

programme.title: Nevada Smith (1966)
programme.desc: The son of a Native American mother and a white father dedicates his life to gaining revenge on the three outlaws who murdered them. Western adventure, starring Steve McQueen, Karl Malden, Brian Keith, Arthur Kennedy and Suzanne Pleshette

programme.title: The Cowboys (1972)
programme.desc: An ageing rancher finds himself short-handed when his workers abandon him during a gold rush, and grudgingly hires a group of schoolboys to help him on a 400-mile cattle drive. Western, with John Wayne, Roscoe Lee Browne and Bruce Dern

programme.title: Live LaLiga
programme.desc: Real Madrid v Celta Vigo (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Spanish top-flight match at The Bernabeu, as the teams face each other for the second time this season. Real have won the last five matches in succession against The Sky Blues, including a 4-1 victory in the reverse fixture last August. Semra Hunter presents, with analysis from Albert Ferrer and Guillem Balague, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Terry Gibson

programme.title: First Blood (1982)
programme.desc: Vietnam veteran John Rambo is wrongfully arrested in a backwoods town and tested to the limits of his endurance by a brutal deputy. Rambo escapes from his cell and heads out to the woods, and with the forces of the law in hot pursuit he finally has the chance to fight them on his own terms. Action thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Brian Dennehy, Richard Crenna and David Caruso

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George discovers some of the UK's most impressive historic homes, as he is granted special access to some of these extraordinary places, delving into the hidden recesses that visitors don't normally get to see. In this first episode, George's journey begins in Dorset at the UK's most exquisite example of Italianate architecture - the magnificent 17th-century Kingston Lacy. He uncovers a tale of shame and scandal on the south coast, and the beautiful Cotswold landmark - Hidcote Manor Gardens - in full bloom takes his breath away. George also mines the history of the country's last cave dwellers at one of Britain's best-kept secrets, the Rock Houses at Kinver Edge, and finally, with his husky Loki, takes a walk at spectacular Studland Bay, part of the Jurassic Coast World Heritage Site

programme.title: Caravan Holidays with Shane Richie
programme.desc: The actor visits a vast campsite in North Yorkshire, which has its own theme park and zoo. The place is so big that guests can call for a golf-buggy taxi just to take them to their room. Once, settled in, Shane hops on the cable cars for an aerial view of the park's rollercoasters and wild animal enclosures. He also explores the local area, taking in a steam train trip from inside the driver's cabin and a fishing trip out of Whitby. Following in his father's footsteps as an performer, Shane's son arrives with his band to perform as the site's entertainment

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe convinces herself she is a walking jinx who keeps causing people to die mysteriously. Monica hides the fact that Ben has been injured, while Chandler and Janice make a tough decision about their relationship

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross discovers a strange growth on his buttocks, Phoebe finds it hard to choose between two prospective lovers, and Monica's boyfriend surprises her. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: On the Nottinghamshire border, Craig responds to a report of a serious assault on a late-night train and an off-duty officer who tried to intervene also says she was struck by the assailants. In Long Eaton, Dave and Jason are called to the scene of a car crash, but what at first seems like a bad accident involving a suspected stolen car eventually leads to the arrest of the car's owner for perverting the course of justice

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation edition reliving house-transforming triumphs from the series. Property expert Ann Maurice visits Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire, to demonstrate design techniques for making small rooms appear bigger, while in Glasgow she reveals how to create a home that appeals to potential purchasers

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Sheep learns that she has got a new job far away, and Peppa and Suzy wonder how they can stay best friends

programme.title: Lonely Are the Brave (1962)
programme.desc: A rebellious modern-day cowboy breaks out of jail and escapes on horseback - but reckons without the relentlessness of the authorities, who give chase by car and helicopter. A dogged sheriff leads the pursuit, coming to sympathise with his quarry. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Gena Rowlands and George Kennedy

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: It Should Happen to You (1954)
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: Anne of the Indies (1951)
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: Ghostbusters (2016)
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occurs in New York City, two experts in the paranormal investigate, joined by a brilliant inventor who has created an array of ghost-hunting gadgets and a public transport worker whose knowledge of the city provides vital clues to the sinister cause of the ghostly activity. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout (2018)
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarrie's sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise and Henry Cavill

programme.title: Little Fockers (2010)
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Searching (2018)
programme.desc: When his 16-year-old daughter Margot disappears from her California home, and a police investigation yields few results, David Kim decides to explore her laptop. He contacts her friends in the hope of gleaning some information regarding her location, and discovers a secret about her piano lessons that could be a vital key to the puzzle. Thriller, starring John Cho and Debra Messing

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck! (1960)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama, charting the mission to track down and eliminate the pride of the German fleet, a fearsome battleship devastating British vessels in the North Atlantic, orchestrated by a British naval officer recovering from his wife's death in an air raid. Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (1957)
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern

programme.title: The Desert Rats (1953)
programme.desc: A Scottish army officer is placed in command of a unit of Australian troops given the task of defending Tobruk against overwhelming German forces, led by the renowned general Rommel. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Burton, Robert Newton and James Mason, reprising his role as Rommel from The Desert Fox

programme.title: Mortal Engines (2018)
programme.desc: In a post-apocalyptic world where cities ride on wheels and consume each other to survive, two people meet in London and try to stop a conspiracy. Fantasy adventure adapted from the Philip Reeve novel by The Lord of the Rings' Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens and Peter Jackson. Starring Hera Hilmar, Robert Sheehan and Hugo Weaving

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: Rhino (2021)
programme.desc: A bandit nicknamed Rhinoceros falls into the grip of the Ukrainian criminal world in the 1990s. Drama, starring Serhii Filimonov

programme.title: I Blame Society (2020)
programme.desc: A struggling filmmaker realises the skills to make a movie are the same to commit the perfect murder. Comedy thriller, starring Gillian Wallace Horvat, who also directed and co-wrote the script with co-star Chase Williamson

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course (2016)
programme.desc: When Scrat causes a cosmic blunder that leaves Earth in the path of an asteroid, it's up to Sid the sloth and pals Manny and Diego to save the day. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, Denis Leary, John Leguizamo and Simon Pegg

programme.title: Alpha (2018)
programme.desc: Europe, 20,000 years ago, and a young man is left for dead while hunting with his tribe. After forming an alliance with a lone wolf that was abandoned by its pack, the duo attempts to make their way to safety. Prehistoric adventure, starring Kodi Smit-McPhee and Jóhannes Haukur Jóhannesson. Directed by Albert Hughes (The Book of Eli)

programme.title: Leap Year (2010)
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott

programme.title: Evolution (2001)
programme.desc: Two science teachers investigate a mysterious meteor and discover it is oozing a strange fluid containing millions of minuscule but rapidly evolving organisms - which start to turn into terrifying alien monsters with a taste for human flesh. Sci-fi comedy, starring David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Seann William Scott, Dan Aykroyd and Ted Levine

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Knives Out (2019)
programme.desc: Wealthy crime novelist Harlan Thrombey invites his kin to an 85th birthday party at his mansion, but festivities are cut short by arguments. When the writer apparently commits suicide, Detective Lieutenant Elliott and Trooper Wagner attend the scene, while private detective Benoit Blanc hovers in the background, closely observing family members. Writer/director Rian Johnson's comedy crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Chris Evans and Ana de Armas

programme.title: American Psycho (2000)
programme.desc: A financier in 1980s New York tries desperately to present an image of success and outshine his peers in the business world, while secretly committing horrific acts of rape, torture and murder for his own enjoyment. His carefully ordered life begins to unravel when a detective investigates his crimes. Satirical drama based on Bret Easton Ellis's novel, starring Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Reese Witherspoon

programme.title: Climax (2018)
programme.desc: A group of dancers have gathered in a deserted building to rehearse, but someone has spiked the sangria. Writer/director Gaspar Noe's psychological horror, starring Sofia Boutella, Kiddy Smile and Romain Guillermic. In French with English subtitles

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren goes back on his promise to Sienna, Donna-Marie wants someone to talk to, and James visits Eric in prison with his appeal strategy update

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: An unfriendly familiar face shows up at the casino night. Elsewhere, Imran is feeling suffocated by his mum and Zain's over protectiveness

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor

In the first edition, Aina, a music producer from London, wants to find someone adventurous who she can have a deeper connection with, while Guildford-based designer Mal - who has dated men and women - is curious to see who she will be drawn to when all options are laid bare before her. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole refurbishes a classic Ford Mustang and a neon garage sign, while Simon O'Brien restores a classic Chopper bicycle and turns a bass guitar into a chair

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look into the case of a former member of the Royal College of Surgeons, and race to discover the rightful owners of his inheritance. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owner Helen Marriott offers her guest a chance to 'step off the planet' and treats them to essential breathing lessons, a chance to get to know one another in the hot tub, and soul-soothing foot massages at the Fountains Court Holistic Health Hotel in the North Yorkshire resort of Scarborough

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to the Whittington & Cat, a pub in Hull that also offers B&B. Proprietor Sue Perkins treats her guests to an afternoon of ice hockey, but they are intrigued by the possible contents of her peculiarly titled breakfast menu

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Khurram Saba hosts the third day of the competition at his Saba Hotel in west London and finds his guests are expecting metropolitan chic, and certainly not fish and chips for dinner. Candida Leaver is extremely displeased when she experiences a sleepless night, while Sue Perkins and Gill take the opportunity to go out and have some fun

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Candida Leaver and Peter Starling, owners of the Bower Inn in Bridgwater, Somerset, play host in the last round of the week. The group activity is willow-weaving, and at dinner time the guests reveal what they think of their no-nonsense hosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: Love It or List It Australia
programme.desc: Sibon and Gerard live with their two teenage boys in a dilapidated home in the prestigious Sydney suburb of Hunters Hill. Andrew Winter and Neale Whitaker visit their Californian-style bungalow, with its leaky roof, gutters that are falling off, and rooms that are full of mould

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Farhalls in Windsor, who are unsure whether to sell their four-bedroom detached house or transform the layout of their home. Graham loves living in Windsor but Nardeth is growing tired of their cramped and dated house, and would prefer to look for a new property they could purchase

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Couple Mariam and Johnno arrive at their new chateau with their teenage son Monty and discover that they have no running water and that builders are busy in every room. To get respite from the heat and building work, Mariam visits Angel to get help turning her designs into tiles for her new home. Abbie and her mum Karen have wallpaper decisions to make, and wrangle oversized cots as they continue to get their chateau ready for the biggest wedding party of the season

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Jonathan Broom and his wife Deborah have put everything on hold while he pursues his dream of building a miniature Hollywood Hills-style mansion. They stumble across a scrap of land in north London, but it's fraught with problems and the only way they can complete the £1million home is by sinking half of it six metres below ground. Surrounded on all sides by their neighbours' back gardens, the couple have to dismantle walls and fences and promise to put them back together again, and that's just the start of their difficulties. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: The Dog House Australia

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: This edition focuses on how young males can lead each other into criminality, and how what may start as youthful pranks can easily progress to committing offences. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.desc: The owners of a French B&B decide to venture into catering and host their first trial run. Two ice-cream makers fight back as their business faces closure. Later, after months of painful renovations, it's payback time for two English artists as they open their B&B

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole restores a petrol pump and turns a hubcap into a clock, and Simon O'Brien repurposes a copper immersion heater into a stylish wash basin

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jed and Mandy Filmer welcome their rivals to the Hotel la Tartana on Spain's Costa Tropical, and hope to impress them with a cookery class - not realising one of their guests is a qualified chef. A revelation at dinner stuns the group, before the Filmers' attitude to breakfast service jeopardises their chances of victory

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julia Grant hosts the third round of the competition in Spain at her Benidorm B&B The Queens Hotel. Her guests are not impressed with her standards of cleanliness, finding dirt, dust and hairs, and tensions rise at dinner over her 'straight-friendly' label. The owner improves the evening by giving everyone a drag makeover and persuading them to perform in a revue, but some of the feedback she receives leaves her enraged

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final hosts in Spain are Alastair Smith and Martyn Watson, owners of the gay and naturist-friendly Almond Tree Villa in Murcia. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: University lecturer Amanda Sherratt is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in Lincolnshire, joined by beetroot farmer Chris Moore, theatre student Jack Stone, retail manager Ali Roberts and fitness enthusiast Alex Coxon. Amanda takes a risk with her Japanese-themed evening, which includes a raw fish starter and sumo-wrestling for entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Farmer Chris Moore hosts the third dinner party in Lincolnshire, where he plans to wow his guests with a beetroot-themed dinner. However, it is not just his obsession with the vegetable that surprises his diners, as they soon discover he has some hidden talents

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On day four in Lincolnshire, Jack Stone plans to win over his guests with a creative evening during which they will have the chance to make their own food, but the DIY pizzas don't go to plan. Meanwhile, an interesting outfit from Alex Coxon gets the attention of Chris Moore

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Secrets of the Queen's Coronation

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost.
